title: `unused-lifetimes` lint duplicates "parameter is never used" error

labels.name: A-lint
labels.description: Area: Lints (warnings about flaws in source code) such as unused_mut.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-verbose
labels.description: Too much output caused by a single piece of incorrect code

body:
The following code:

```rust
#![warn(unused_lifetimes)]
struct Foo<'a>;

fn main() {}

```

gives the following output:

```
arning: lifetime parameter `'a` never used
 --> unused_lifetime.rs:2:12
  |
2 | struct Foo<'a>;
  |           -^^- help: elide the unused lifetime
  |
note: the lint level is defined here
 --> unused_lifetime.rs:1:9
  |
1 | #![warn(unused_lifetimes)]
  |         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

error[E0392]: parameter `'a` is never used
 --> unused_lifetime.rs:2:12
  |
2 | struct Foo<'a>;
  |            ^^ unused parameter
  |
  = help: consider removing `'a`, referring to it in a field, or using a marker such as `std::marker::PhantomData`

error: aborting due to previous error; 1 warning emitted

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0392`.
```

The "unused lifetimes" warning is redundant - not using a lifetime parameter is a hard error, so the warning gives no additional information.
